page.title: 19Separating Gardens.
page.content:
In old records of the Carnoustie area (some are as old as the original Domesday Book) an old hedge is spoken of and its position is given.Part of the hedge still exists and is now used as a garden boundry. Nowadays there are many different ways of separating gardens.A sample in Carnoustie was studied.{ { { GARDEN SEPARATION IN CARNOUSTIE Open-plan Hedges Walls Fences { 2 9 1 3
Mostly the gardens of the new houses are surrounded by a wall or are open- plan.Some do have fences and hedges. However, hedges are the most common surrounding for the gardens of old houses.Some of the old and the new houses separate their gardens with trees but this isn't common.
